comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: They are walking on a temporary boardwalk near recently-plowed turf.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There was a school for deaconesses associated with the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. August 17, 1913, NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E03E1DB113BE633A... indicates that a home for the deaconesses in training had been recently completed and that a new Synod Hall would be essentially complete by September 1, for a convention of the Episcopal Church in October. The article has a picture that looks like the building at the right (as the Synod Hall). Perhaps they didn't get the landscaping addressed fully until the next spring. Looking at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cathedral_Saint_John_Divine_NY..., I would judge that the Synod Hall is in the lower right corner of the Cathedral campus, and that the deaconesses were walking towards the cathedral when this picture was taken.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Swanq: Thank you. It looks like you are correct that these are buildings on the grounds of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. We will add some information about this to the description when we update.
